intro: Jaffrea, commonly known as the common jaffrea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in the summer. The plant is native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Jaffrea species are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported health benefits. Its foliage is also utilized as a culinary herb, adding a distinctive flavor to various dishes.
